intro: Acinodendron parviflorum, commonly known as the small-flowered acinodendron, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Africa. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes over 13,000 species of flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its small, white or pale yellow flowers arranged in clusters. Its leaves are typically opposite and have a rough, hairy texture. Acinodendron parviflorum is often found in shaded, moist habitats such as forests and shrublands.
